TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IMethodMessage implements class System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessage

remarks.format:
## Remarks A method message is used to send information to and from remote methods. For example, messages used for remote method calls implement the IMethodMessage interface.
## Examples The following example code shows a custom proxy that overrides `RealProxy.Invoke` in order to write the message information to the console and return immediately without making a remote call.
[!code-cpp[IMethodMessage_MethodName#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.runtime.remotin_38_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[IMethodMessage_MethodName#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.runtime.remotin_38_1.cs)] [!code-vb[IMethodMessage_MethodName#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.runtime.remotin_38_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the number of arguments passed to the method.
Docs.value: The number of arguments passed to the method.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example code shows a custom proxy that overrides `RealProxy.Invoke` in order to write the message information to the console, using the `ArgCount` property to iterate through the arguments.
[!code-cpp[IMethodMessage_MethodName#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.runtime.remotin_19_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[IMethodMessage_MethodName#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.runtime.remotin_19_1.cs)] [!code-vb[IMethodMessage_MethodName#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.runtime.remotin_19_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets an array of arguments passed to the method.
Docs.value: An array containing the arguments passed to the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Although the Args property is redundant since the same functionality can be achieved through the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMethodMessage.ArgCount%2A> and <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMethodMessage.GetArg%2A>, there might be performance optimization available if the implementer understands when all the arguments will be retrieved.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example code shows a custom proxy that overrides `RealProxy.Invoke` in order to write the message information to the console, including whether the method call has variable arguments.
[!code-cpp[IMethodMessage_MethodName#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/p-system.runtime.remotin_93_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[IMethodMessage_MethodName#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.runtime.remotin_93_1.cs)] [!code-vb[IMethodMessage_MethodName#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.runtime.remotin_93_1.vb)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks This information is not transmitted to a remote location, but is used to cache the method base after it has been looked up once.

remarks.format: ## Remarks All the current implementations of <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMethodMessage> return an array of <xref:System.Type> objects containing the parameter types of the method.
